Posted By: TheSuperbloop (3/26/2010 9:02:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Yes, yes, we all know the argument against auras. They set you up for card disadvantage, can't be reused, whatever. Wurmweaver Coil, however, has a significant impact upon the game, and can be recycled into a new threat if your opponent tries to kill the creature it's enchanting. Not too shabby.
posts.html:
Yes, yes, we all know the argument against auras. They set you up for card disadvantage, can't be reused, whatever. Wurmweaver Coil, however, has a significant impact upon the game, and can be recycled into a new threat if your opponent tries to kill the creature it's enchanting. Not too shabby.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (1/14/2010 6:13:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Part of the Ravnica subtheme of interesting Auras. Rather fickle since it could be lost when you were trying to put it on your creature ([Shielding Plax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shielding Plax) or the many instant removals), but if it resolved, you just made yourself a great threat.
posts.html:
Part of the Ravnica subtheme of interesting Auras. Rather fickle since it could be lost when you were trying to put it on your creature (Shielding Plax or the many instant removals), but if it resolved, you just made yourself a great threat.
